metadata.title: CVE-2018-18883 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen 4.9.x through 4.11.x, on Intel x86platforms, allowing x86 HVM and PVH guests to cause a host OS denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact because nested VT-x is not properly restricted.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.1-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.1-1
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenmisc4.11 - 4.11.1-1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-4.11 - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1-1').
